translation.en: Hi. It's me, Marley Dias.
Welcome to Bookmarks: Celebrating Black Voices.
translation.ko: '이야기가 시작되는 북마크' '세상에 울려 퍼지는 블랙 보이스' 시간입니다

translation.en: I Love My Hair! is a celebration of Black girl beauty
translation.ko: '아이 러브 마이 헤어'는 흑인 여성의 아름다움과

translation.en: and the power of natural hair.
The book is written by Natasha Anastasia Tarpley
and illustrated by E.B. Lewis.
I Love My Hair! is going to be read to us by Tiffany Haddish.
translation.ko: '아이 러브 마이 헤어'는 티퍼니 해디시가 읽어드리겠습니다

translation.en: Hi. I'm Tiffany Haddish.
And today I'm reading I Love My Hair!
translation.ko: 오늘은 '아이 러브 마이 헤어'를 읽어 드릴게요

translation.en: Every night before I go to bed, Mama combs my hair.
translation.ko: 매일 밤 잠들기 전에 엄마는 내 머리를 빗겨 주세요

translation.en: I sit between her knees,
resting my elbows on her thighs, like pillows.
translation.ko: 엄마의 허벅지를 베개 삼아 팔을 얹죠

translation.en: Mama is always gentle.
She rubs coconut oil along my scalp
and slowly pulls a comb through my hair,
translation.ko: 빗으로 천천히 내 머리를 빗겨 주세요

translation.en: but sometimes it still hurts.
Mm. I know how she feel.
When Mama gets to especially tangled places,
translation.ko: 머리카락이 유난히 엉킨 곳을 빗을 때면

translation.en: I try my hardest not to cry,
sucking in my breath
and pressing my hands together until they're red.
But a few tears always manage to squeeze out.
translation.ko: 하지만 어쩔 수 없이 눈물이 흘러요

translation.en: "Mama, stop!" I cry
when I can't stand the comb tugging at my hair any longer.
translation.ko: 빗이 머리를 심하게 잡아당기면 난 참지 못하고 소리쳐요

translation.en: Aw, I know that feeling, girl. It be hurtin'! Mm-mm-mm.
Mama puts the comb down and rubs my hurting places,
translation.ko: 엄마는 빗을 내려놓고 아픈 곳을 문질러 주세요

translation.en: then she leans in close to me, like she has a big secret to tell.
translation.ko: 그러곤 엄청난 비밀을 말해 주듯 나한테 기대어 말씀하시죠

translation.en: "Do you know why you're so lucky
to have this head of hair, Keyana?" she asks.
translation.ko: '얼마나 큰 행운인지 알고 있니, 케야나?' 엄마가 물으시면

translation.en: I shake my head no.
"Because it's beautiful
and you can wear it in any style you choose.
translation.ko: '원하는 대로 어떤 머리든 할 수 있거든'

translation.en: I can spin your hair into fine, soft yarn,
just like our grandmothers did at their spinning wheels,
translation.ko: '네 머리를 가늘고 부드러운 실처럼 빙빙 감아서'

translation.en: and weave it into a puffy little bun."
A puffy little bun? If I had a spinning wheel,
I probably would weave it into a sweater.
Just to stay warm for the winter.
"Or I can put your hair into straight lines
and plant rows of braids along your scalp,
the way we plant seeds in our garden,
then wait and watch for them to grow."
Mm. Now, that's what we call "cornrows."
Mm-hmm. I love cornrows.
In the morning, before we walk to the store,
Mama adds colorful beads to the ends of my braids.
translation.ko: 땋은 머리끝에 엄마가 색색 구슬을 달아 주세요

translation.en: The beads click to the rhythm of my walk,
translation.ko: 걸을 때마다 구슬이 부딪치며 소리가 나고

translation.en: helping me remember what we're going to buy:
translation.ko: 덕분에 무엇을 사야 할지 기억할 수 있죠

translation.en: ♪ Tap! Tap! Clickety-clack! ♪
♪ Milk, bread, peanut butter ♪
Folks on the street look at me and smile as I dance along
translation.ko: 내가 춤추는 걸 보고 지나가던 사람들이 미소 지어요

translation.en: to the Tap! Tap! Clickety-clack! music my hair makes just for me.
translation.ko: '똑! 딱! 똑딱!' 나만을 위해 내 머리가 연주하는 곡이에요

translation.en: Now, I'ma tell you, when I was younger, I used to always have my hair in beads.
translation.ko: 있잖아요, 저는 어렸을 때 항상 머리에 구슬을 달았어요

translation.en: And my favorite thing was to jump rope with the hair and my beads--
They'd be like, clickety-clackety...
And sometimes, I would be in class, in elementary school,
and I'd just do my hair like this, click, click…
when my teacher would say stuff I didn't want to hear.
translation.ko: 듣기 싫은 이야기를 선생님이 하시면 그랬죠

translation.en: Lesson learned. That's how you get detention.
Don't click-clack your beads in class.
Some days I just let my hair be free to do what it wants,
translation.ko: 어떤 날은 그냥 자유롭게 머리를 풀고

translation.en: to go any which-way it pleases.
Then my hair surrounds my head, like a globe.
translation.ko: 그러면 머리카락이 지구본처럼 둥글게 내 머리를 감싸죠

translation.en: This is my Afro style.
Aw, I love this picture because this is exactly what I look like with an Afro.
translation.ko: 이 그림 정말 마음에 드네요 제가 아프로를 하면 딱 이래요

translation.en: I love my globe. Look at that.
This is what we call an Afro, honey.
Yes! And you get one of these combs here, and you just pick it out.
translation.ko: 자, 이런 빗을 가져다가 이렇게 세워 주면 돼요

translation.en: And I'm ready to go to the disco.
Once when I wore it, the kids at school teased me.
translation.ko: 내가 이런 머리를 하면 학교 친구들이 나를 놀려요

translation.en: My head felt heavy, and I let it hang down low.
But my teacher made me feel better.
translation.ko: 하지만 선생님이 내 기분을 풀어 주셨어요

translation.en: She said that when she was growing up,
folks counted their hair as a blessing.
Wearing an Afro was a way for them to stand up for what they believed in,
translation.ko: 아프로를 한다는 건 자기 믿음을 보여 주고

translation.en: to let the world know that they were proud of who they were
and where they came from.
I know that's right.
I love my hair
because it's thick as a forest, soft as cotton candy,
and curly as a vine winding upward,
reaching the sky and climbing towards outer space.
Aw, that's cool.
I want my hair to climb towards outer space. I'm not gonna lie.
translation.ko: 제 머리도 바깥세상으로 뻗어 가면 좋겠어요

translation.en: That's a lot of hair, though, to get to outer space.
Could you imagine how much hair it would take to get to outer space?
I don't know if my neck could handle it.
But today I'm wearing it in my favorite style of all:
translation.ko: 오늘은 내가 가장 좋아하는 스타일을 했어요

translation.en: two ponytails that stick out on either side of my head
that flap in the air like a pair of wings.
One of these days I just might take off and fly.
translation.ko: 이런 머리를 하면 하늘을 날 수 있을 것만 같아요!

translation.en: Now wouldn't that be cool?
That's my favorite. Like, ponytails on each side?
My favorite.
Well, we just finished reading
I Love My Hair! by Natasha Anastasia Tarpley.
translation.ko: 너태샤 애너스터지아 타플리가 쓴 '아이 러브 마이 헤어'였어요

translation.en: Besides your hair, what else do you love about yourself?
translation.ko: 머리 말고도 자신의 어떤 점이 마음에 드나요?

translation.en: Me? I love my scalp!
When I can take my hair off and just relax!
translation.ko: 가발을 벗고 편히 쉴 때가 최고죠!

translation.en: I'll see you guys later.
Keep reading.
And love who you are.
♪ You born wit' it Adorned wit' it ♪ ♪ A gift to the world Go'n give it ♪
♪ Don't forget who you are ♪
